info.title: Peatio Management API v2
info.description: Management API is server-to-server API with high privileges.

post.description: Queries the account balance for the given UID and currency.

201.description: Queries the account balance for the given UID and currency.

put.description: Allows to load money or cancel deposit.

200.description: Allows to load money or cancel deposit.

post.description: Creates new fiat deposit with state set to «submitted». Optionally pass field «state» set to «accepted» if want to load money instantly. You can also use PUT /fiat_deposits/:id later to load money or cancel deposit.

parameters.name: tid
parameters.description: The shared transaction ID. Must not exceed 64 characters. Peatio will generate one automatically unless supplied.

201.description: Creates new fiat deposit with state set to «submitted». Optionally pass field «state» set to «accepted» if want to load money instantly. You can also use PUT /fiat_deposits/:id later to load money or cancel deposit.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of deposits per page (defaults to 100, maximum is 1000).

put.description: «process» – system will lock the money, check for suspected activity, validate recipient address, and initiate the processing of the withdraw. «cancel»  – system will mark withdraw as «canceled», and unlock the money.

post.description: Creates new withdraw. The behaviours for fiat and crypto withdraws are different. Fiat: money are immediately locked, withdraw state is set to «submitted», system workers will validate withdraw later against suspected activity, and assign state to «rejected» or «accepted». The processing will not begin automatically. The processing may be initiated manually from admin panel or by PUT /management_api/v1/withdraws/action. Coin: money are immediately locked, withdraw state is set to «submitted», system workers will validate withdraw later against suspected activity, validate withdraw address and set state to «rejected» or «accepted». Then in case state is «accepted» withdraw workers will perform interactions with blockchain. The withdraw receives new state «processing». Then withdraw receives state either «confirming» or «failed».Then in case state is «confirming» withdraw confirmations workers will perform interactions with blockchain.Withdraw receives state «succeed» when it receives minimum necessary amount of confirmations.

parameters.name: tid
parameters.description: The shared transaction ID. Must not exceed 64 characters. Peatio will generate one automatically unless supplied.

parameters.name: rid
parameters.description: The beneficiary ID or wallet address on the Blockchain.

parameters.name: beneficiary_id
parameters.description: ID of Active Beneficiary belonging to user.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of objects per page (defaults to 100, maximum is 1000).

post.description: Returns server time in seconds since Unix epoch.

parameters.name: limit

parameters.name: time_from
parameters.description: An integer represents the seconds elapsed since Unix epoch.If set, only operations after the time will be returned.

parameters.name: time_to
parameters.description: An integer represents the seconds elapsed since Unix epoch.If set, only operations before the time will be returned.

post.description: Returns trading_fees table as paginated collection

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of objects per page (defaults to 100, maximum is 1000).

201.description: Returns trading_fees table as paginated collection

parameters.name: min_collection_amount
parameters.description: Minimal deposit amount that will be collected

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique market id. It's always in the form of xxxyyy,where xxx is the base currency code, yyy is the quotecurrency code, e.g. 'btcusd'. All available markets canbe found at /api/v2/markets.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Market state defines if user can see/trade on current market.

Balance.description: Queries the account balance for the given UID and currency.

state.description: The deposit state. «submitted» – initial state. «canceled» – deposit has been canceled by outer service. «rejected» – deposit has been rejected by outer service.. «accepted» – deposit has been accepted by outer service, money are loaded.

created_at.description: The datetime when deposit was created.

completed_at.description: The datetime when deposit was completed.

blockchain_txid.description: The transaction ID on the Blockchain (coin only).

blockchain_confirmations.description: The number of transaction confirmations on the Blockchain (coin only).

rid.description: The beneficiary ID or wallet address on the Blockchain.

state.description: The withdraw state. «prepared» – initial state, money are not locked. «submitted» – withdraw has been allowed by outer service for further validation, money are locked. «canceled» – withdraw has been canceled by outer service, money are unlocked. «accepted» – system has validated withdraw and queued it for processing by worker, money are locked. «rejected» – system has validated withdraw and found errors, money are unlocked. «processing» – worker is processing withdraw as the current moment, money are locked. «skipped» – worker skipped withdrawal in case of insufficient balance of hot wallet or it absence. «succeed» – worker has successfully processed withdraw, money are subtracted from the account. «failed» – worker has encountered an unhandled error while processing withdraw, money are unlocked.

created_at.description: The datetime when withdraw was created.

blockchain_txid.description: The transaction ID on the Blockchain (coin only).

code.description: The Account code which this operation related to.

created_at.description: The datetime when operation was created.
Trade create time in iso8601 format.

taker_type.description: Trade maker order type (sell or buy).

min_confirmations.description: Number of confirmations required for confirming deposit or withdrawal

min_collection_amount.description: Minimal deposit amount that will be collected

subunits.description: Fraction of the basic monetary unit.

created_at.description: Currency created time in iso8601 format.

updated_at.description: Currency updated time in iso8601 format.

id.description: Unique market id. It's always in the form of xxxyyy,where xxx is the base currency code, yyy is the quotecurrency code, e.g. 'btcusd'. All available markets canbe found at /api/v2/markets.

state.description: Market state defines if user can see/trade on current market.

created_at.description: Market created time in iso8601 format.

updated_at.description: Market updated time in iso8601 format.
